paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the role of the S4–S5 linker in the hERG K+ channel, focusing on mutations in the KCNH2 gene and their effects on channel gating kinetics. No specific patient-level penetrance data or clinical significance ratings for the variants were provided.

functional_data.summary: Mutation D540A affects the rate of activation, making it significantly faster at low voltage gradients.

variants.evidence_level: Functional data from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Numerous previous studies have investigated the effects of mutations in the hERG S4–S5 linker and identified important roles for Asp540.

functional_data.summary: Mutation S543A causes a significant hyperpolarising shift in the V0.5 for steady-state activation.

variants.evidence_level: Functional data from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Mutations to Ser543 had more complex phenotypes indicating additional interactions.

functional_data.summary: Mutation Y545A affects the rate of activation, making it significantly slower at high voltage gradients.

variants.evidence_level: Functional data from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Mutations to Tyr545 had more complex phenotypes indicating additional interactions.

functional_data.summary: Mutation G546A causes a significant hyperpolarising shift in the V0.5 for steady-state activation.

variants.evidence_level: Functional data from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Numerous previous studies have investigated the effects of mutations in the hERG S4–S5 linker and identified important roles for Gly546.

functional_data.summary: Mutation A548V causes a significant hyperpolarising shift in the V0.5 for steady-state activation and affects the rate of activation.

variants.evidence_level: Functional data from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Mutations to Ala548 had more complex phenotypes indicating additional interactions.

challenges: No specific patient-level penetrance data or clinical significance ratings were provided.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper focused on functional studies of mutations in the KCNH2 gene without providing detailed clinical or penetrance data.
